text.description: Italian prime minister leaves hospital in Milan four days after being hit in the face
text.title: Silvio Berlusconi assaulted in Milan

main.head: Silvio Berlusconi assaulted in Milan
main.p: 17 December 2009:The Italian prime minister leaves hospital in Milan four days after being

list.item:
Silvio Berlusconi (C) leaves the San Raffaele hospital in Milan December 17, 2009. Berlusconi was discharged from hospital on Thursday, four days after an attack which left him with a fractured nose and broken teeth.
Photograph: Giampiero Sposito/guardian.co.uk

Italy's Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi leaves the San Raffaele hospital in Milan
Photograph: Giampiero Sposito/guardian.co.uk

Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi (C) waves at supporters during a People for Liberty party (PDL) meeting in Milan just before being assaulted by a man.
Photograph: Giuseppe Aresu/guardian.co.uk

Italian Premier Silvio Berlusconi being struck in the face by a statuette hurled by an attacker at the end of a rally in Milan
Photograph: Livio Anticoli/guardian.co.uk

Massimo Tartaglia, 42, who Italian police said was suspected of attacking Italian Premier Silvio Berlusconi
Photograph: Livio Anticoli/guardian.co.uk

In this TV Grab Picture taken from the RAI24 News channel, shows Italian President Silvio Berlusconi looking on after being assaulted in Milan on December 13, 2009.
Photograph: HO/guardian.co.uk

Image shows Italian Premier Silvio Berlusconi after he was punched in the face at the end of a rally in Milan, Italy on Sunday Dec. 13, 2009 by a man holding a small statue in his hand, leaving the 73-year-old media mogul with a bloodied mouth and looking stunned
Photograph: Livio Anticoli/guardian.co.uk

Berlusconi after the attack
Photograph: Livio Anticoli/guardian.co.uk

Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi sits in his car, after a young man struck him in the face in a Milan square, witnesses and police said on Sunday 13 december 2009.
Photograph: Antonio Bellavia / Matteo Bazzi/guardian.co.uk

Silvio Berlusconi a fter being struck in the face at the end of a rally in Milan, Italy on Sunday Dec. 13, 2009 leaving the 73-year-old media mogul with a bloodied mouth and looking stunned. (AP Photo/RAI TG3 via APTN) ** ITALY OUT **
Photograph: RAI TG3/guardian.co.uk

Photograph: HO/guardian.co.uk
